title: The Role of Gut Microbiota in Colorectal Cancer Pathogenesis: A Comprehensive Literature Review.
abstract: Colorectal cancer (CRC) represents a significant global health burden, ranking as the third most frequently diagnosed malignancy worldwide. Emerging evidence has established a compelling association between gut microbiota dysbiosis and CRC pathogenesis, revealing complex mechanisms through which specific bacterial communities modulate carcinogenesis.
